alert.note: Alert for Latah; Lewis; Nez Perce; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 5:01AM MDT until June 14 at 4:09PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON PDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Latah, Lewis, Nez Perce and Shoshone. Portions of Southeast Washington, including the following county, Asotin. * WHEN...Until noon PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is expected. Mud slides, rock slides or debris flows in steep terrain or near recent burn scars is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 356 AM PDT, Radar indicated additional rainfall to move into the area today. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lewiston, Moscow, Clarkston, St. Maries, Kellogg, Pinehurst, Osburn, Lapwai, Wallace, Plummer, Genesee, Troy, Potlatch, Mullan, Smelterville, Juliaetta, Deary, Craigmont, Nezperce and Culdesac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
